intro: Dyslexia is often defined as an unexpected difficulty in reading, for an individuals chronological age. Some general indications are listed below.
Please answer all the questions. These may be associated with dyslexia if they are unexpected for the individual's age, educational level, or cognitive abilities.
If many of these are observed frequently and the childs score is above 90, we request you to seek inputs from a counsellor
Please read through the unique strengths of children with dyslexia
strengths: Excellent thinking skills: conceptualization, reasoning, imagination,abstraction
Learning that is accomplished best through meaning rather than rote memorization
A high level of understanding of what is read to him
Improvement as an area of interest becomes more specialized and focused
Excels in areas not dependent on reading, such as math
computers and visual arts, or in more conceptual (versus fact-driven) subjects, including philosophy, biology, social studies, neuroscience and creative writing

questions.title: Letter-sound relationship
questions.question: The child Finds it hard to learn letter/sound relationships
questions.name: options_q0

questions.title: Similar shapes/sounds
questions.question: The child confuses letters or words with similar shapes or sounds
questions.name: options_q1

questions.title: Sound out simple words
questions.question: The child finds it hard to sound out simple words
questions.name: options_q2

questions.title: Omission
questions.question: The child may reverse, insert or omit words, letters and numbers
questions.name: options_q3

questions.title: Simple word spelling
questions.question: The child may have difficulty with spelling very simple regular words
questions.name: options_q4

questions.title: Muddling order
questions.question: The child may muddle the order of letters and words
questions.name: options_q5

questions.title: Constantly losing reading position
questions.question: The child keeps losing the place when reading
questions.name: options_q6

questions.title: Discomfort in reading
questions.question: The child may describe visual discomfort when reading text
questions.name: options_q7

questions.title: Slow reading/writing
questions.question: The child may read and do written work very slowly
questions.name: options_q8

questions.title: Difficulty in pronouncing words
questions.question: The child may have difficulty pronouncing common long words
questions.name: options_q9

questions.title: Rhymes and sounds
questions.question: The child may show difficulty in hearing rhymes and sounds within words
questions.name: options_q10

questions.title: Writing skills
questions.question: The child may have poorly spaced, poorly formed, large faint or small heavily indented writing
questions.name: options_q11

questions.title: Memorising
questions.question: The child may face difficulty in memorising (especially in number work) despite adequate support and in-school practice
questions.name: options_q12

questions.title: Telling the time
questions.question: The child may be slow to learn to tell the time
questions.name: options_q13

questions.title: Tying shoe laces
questions.question: The child may face difficulty to tie shoe laces
questions.name: options_q14

questions.title: Sides and Directions
questions.question: The child may often confuse left/right and up/down
questions.name: options_q15

questions.title: Order of alphabets/months
questions.question: The child faces difficulty in  learning the letters of the alphabet, months and days in order
questions.name: options_q16

questions.title: Speech and language development
questions.question: The child may have delayed speech and language development
questions.name: options_q17

questions.title: Copying text
questions.question: The child may have difficulty copying from the board
questions.name: options_q18

questions.title: Oral instructions
questions.question: The child may have difficulty carrying out an oral instruction or, more commonly, multiple oral instructions
questions.name: options_q19

questions.title: Forget/lose things
questions.question: The child may have poor organising ability – losing and forgetting things
questions.name: options_q20

questions.title: Perception of depth
questions.question: The child may have poor coordination and depth perception – tripping and bumping into things
questions.name: options_q21

questions.title: Distracted easily
questions.question: The child may get easily distracted
questions.name: options_q22
